page.title: 08 INGESTRE HALL TODAY
page.content: In 1961, the 21st Earl of Shrewsbury sold Ingestre Hall to the West Bromwich Council. It is now a Residential Arts Centre offering courses in Art, drama and music. At present, the hall maintains 27 acres of land, some of which are "capability Brown" design. There are Landscape gardens on display with lawns flowerbeds, and Albino and Indian Peacocks can be seen in the grounds. Other facilities include play areas, a miniture golf course and an outdoor swimming pool. Close to the Hall there is a beautiful Chapel, erected in 1676 by Sir Walter Chetwynd, grandson of the man who built the present hall. It is elegant and classical and beleived to be a Wren design. The Chapel is still used for services today.
